meanings.definition: Preserve (a corpse) from decay, originally with spices and perfumes.
meanings.sent1: The funeral director carefully embalmed the body to prevent it from decaying.
meanings.sent2: They embalmed the deceased with special chemicals to preserve the body for the viewing.
meanings.sent3: The embalming process turned into a fragrant ritual with the scent of spices filling the room.
meanings.sent4: She thought of embalming as a way to freeze time, preserving memories in a lifeless form.
meanings.sent5: The art of embalming transformed the body into a peaceful, eternal slumber.

meanings.definition: The process of preserving a corpse from decay.
meanings.sent1: After the embalming, the body looked peaceful and well-preserved.
meanings.sent2: The embalming of the deceased was done with great care and respect.
meanings.sent3: During the embalming, the mortician accidentally spilled perfume, creating a comical situation.
meanings.sent4: The embalming process was like a shield against the relentless march of time.
meanings.sent5: The ancient art of embalming has been practiced for centuries to honor the departed.
